metadata.title: CVE-2018-18016 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
ImageMagick 7.0.7-28 has a memory leak vulnerability in WritePCXImage incoders/pcx.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18016` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
imagemagick-6-common - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
imagemagick-6.q16hdri - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libimage-magick-q16hdri-perl - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagick++-6.q16-9t64 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagick++-6.q16hdri-9t64 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickcore-6.q16-7-extra - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickcore-6.q16-7t64 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-7-extra - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-7t64 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickwand-6.q16-7t64 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
libmagickwand-6.q16hdri-7t64 - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
perlmagick - 8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.10.23+dfsg-2.1ubuntu1').
